XenotypeDef.label: headlox
XenotypeDef.description: After several failures at creating the Headlox to give deserving and ambitious enough rulers of various worlds the chance to become as beautiful and endless as they desired, a particularly ambitious Melan Inc. outpost approached it from a new angle. \n\nWhat if they could use some of the genestock that led to the Hemoloc and mix it with the more stable Highmate related genes. The product was a difficult to recreate Xenotype that was just as ageless as the bloodfeeder xenotypes but retained the beauty and bonding ability of their base.
XenotypeDef.descriptionShort: Headlox often appear as leaders as their agelessness and their lack of reproductive ability means becoming one is an endless commitment or sometimes a curse.

XenotypeDef.label: hemoloc
XenotypeDef.description: Following the explosion of interest in the Sanguophage, a Melan Inc. outpost worked hard to replicate the combination in their own genestock, leading to the creation of the Hemoloc, renamed from the more appropriate Dhampir to match their robust backlog. Despite wanting to come out with the first inheritable version, all such experiments failed and instead lead to this xenotype. their mix of melanin and the traditional vulnerability to UV rays lead to a much less impactful version, of such, as well as a less voracious hemogen appetite. \n\nThis initial failure in their original goal was then repackaged and marketed to match the current depiction of the Hemoloc as a more stealth-based Xeno with offensive abilities if they needed to protect themselves, but ultimately able to pass as a normal pawn should it be necessary following their weaknesses.
XenotypeDef.descriptionShort: Hemoloc are known for their stealth and ability to blend in on rim worlds, especially on worlds with little to do with other Sanguophages.
